title: language_test_3_13
prompt:
What is the best way to complete blank 13?

We can help you compare the available ![dropdown:Drop_Down_704_85] the product that best suits your needs.
feedback: The correct answer is "educational tools and find." The sentence should read: “We can help you compare the available educational tools and find the product that best suits your needs.” The second part of the sentence (“find the product that best suits your needs”) is part of a compound predicate. The verb in this sentence is “compare and find.” There should not be any punctuation before the “and” in a compound predicate with two verbs like this one. A comma after the word “find” is also inappropriate.
